intro: Aciotis polystachya, commonly known as the hairy goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually hairy, which helps reduce water loss, and the flowers are yellow with a central disk. Aciotis polystachya is often found in grasslands and along rocky outcrops, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
